parameters.name: command
parameters.description: API operations like INVOKE, VALIDATE, PROCESS can be set or by default PROCESS is set

recordIndicator.description: It specifies the type of record that is loaded

exchangeGroup.description: Exchange group ID. Several Master fund IDs can be grouped under an exchange group. The allowed values are from the list of Ids defined in MFGI table GRP_CHANGE.

tradingDeskMethod.description: Trading desk method code. For example: 0001 (Classic trading desk), 0002 (Prevent using previous day forex), 0003 (New trading desk), 0004 (Trade date NAV for all orders) etc. The LoV is available from CMESS table TA_TRADM.

provisionalClientTradingDeskFlag.description: Flag to allow generation of Provisional client trading desk report. Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

forexByOrderFlag.description: Flag to allow entering exchange rate of the client trading desk for each order.  Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

forecastReportFlag.description: Flag to allow generation of detail cash flow forecast report. Allowed values are Y (to enable), N (to disable) or null (=N)

backupReportFlag.description: Flag to generate automated back-up reports. These reports are: 1. Client Trading Desk report 2. Client Trading Desk with details report 3. Fund Trading Desk report 4. Cash flow forecast report 5. Interim Cash flow forecast report (daily dividend funds only) 6. Reversal Cash flow forecast report. Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No). When it is Y system forces to define the report format and the destination path.

ctvReportFlag.description: Flag to allow printing the CTV reports (summary and detailed) at simulation level following the generation of cash flow forecast report when trade limitations are overcome and the flag CTV Control is ticked at TFC level.  Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

fundFXProcessFlag.description: Flag to enable the followings:1. Warning messages will be displayed at at simulation level to invite the user to run the Fund Trading desk report and to fill the Fund FX rates once the report is re-run but the Fund Fxs have not been input yet2.The user will not be allowed to batch processes the order with out running the Fund Trading Desk report, if necessary and to input the Fund Fx rates at the trading desk screen TAEXGO01.3.The Fund Trading Desk report would become mandatory and the Fund Fx rates recorded for the orders are used for generation of the Sub/Red file.4. If the user enters the exchange rate at the Fund exchange rate window available at the order level, then the system would consider this exchange rates for that order in the generation of the Sub/Red file at the relevant field. Allowed values are Y (to enable the functionalities), N (not to enable the functionalities) or null (=N)

optionalAccountingDateResetFlag.description: Flag to reset the Accounting date TA field at MF fund level after the automatic STP process. Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No).

backupReportFormat.description: Back up report format code in which the backup reports should be generated. For example:PDF, HTML , XLS etc. Allowed values are from the list of codes defined in MFGI.

backupReportPath.description: The physical location where the back up report files should be stored.

updateCode.description: Flag to update the data. Allowed values are:  Y (for Yes), N(for No).Note: Currently, not in use. The functionality of this column has been replaced by the column OPERATION

globalOrdering.description: Flag to enable the Global order functionality. Allowed values are:  Y (for Yes), N(for No).

flgAdvanceFinalClientTrading.description: Flag to consider the orders which are with status 'Ready for final client trading desk' for the final client trading desk process. Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

flgAdditionalFXdetails.description: Flag to populate the the FX details (parameterised at the MF fund level) on the client trading desk. Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

wemEnabled.description: Flag to activate WEM pricing functionality. Allowed values are:  Y (for Yes), N(for No).

navCoolingOffPeriod.description: It specifies the waiting period (in terms of minutes) that a WEM PG process that is linked with the event NAV reception/validation should halt after receiving all the expected NAVs.

forexByOrder.description: Flag to allow entering exchange rate of the fund trading desk for each order.  Allowed values are: Y (for Yes), N (for No)

wemPreAdvice.description: Flag to activate WEM pre-advise functionality. Allowed values are:  Y (for Yes), N(for No).
